In the midst of a pandemic, the Trump Administration and 18 state AGs—including Arizona’s—are in the Supreme Court, trying to strip away health care from millions.

What a total moral failing. We must work to ensure more Arizonans can access affordable healthcare, not less.

Proud to join local leaders at this morning’s Bridge Forum to discuss the issues our Arizona veterans face. 

They have served us and it's our duty to serve them and make sure they have the help, health care and employment opportunities they've earned. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eme5AYPVkAAG9Nx.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eme5AYQU4AAcZyK.jpg
Getting this right isn’t all that hard. But it does take a willingness to embrace science and treat the COVID pandemic as something more than a PR crisis. It’s time for Arizona leaders to step up.

5. Modernize unemployment benefits. Many are still hurting from the harsh economic impact of the pandemic, and Arizona has the second-lowest unemployment safety net in the country. That’s unacceptable—the Governor and legislature should take this on now.

4. Address the spread in nursing homes and long-term care facilities. Test weekly those who care for our most vulnerable to prioritize health care workers and their patients. If we don’t protect our most vulnerable first, we will fail in this fight.

3. Prioritize contact tracing. Arizona has just 5 percent of the number of contact tracers we need to track our spread and identify hotspots. More time has been squandered, but we have the resources to build an effective contact tracing defense. We need to get it done.

2. Continue to expand testing and speed up results. As infection rates rise, we need testing to be fast and readily available for free. More testing data will give us a clearer forecast of this virus and allow us to curb the spread.

1. Mandate masks statewide—now. I was the first to call for an Arizona mandate in June and it’s still necessary. Masks work and save lives—and they are essential to getting us on the path to a faster recovery.

This is one of the worst failures of government leaders in Arizona history. They fell asleep at the wheel during the spring shutdown and failed to prepare for our summer surge. And they’ve failed to prepare for the second wave we all knew was coming.

Here’s what we need to do:

In Arizona, COVID-19 cases are rising as fast as they did in June. Today we saw our highest number of new cases since July. Hospitals fear they'll soon be overwhelmed. We are on the same deadly path, but state leaders have refused to change course.

RT @Sen_JoeManchin Let me be clear: I will not vote to pack the courts & I will not vote to end the filibuster. The U.S. Senate is the most deliberative body in the world. It was made so that we work together in a bipartisan way. If you get rid of the filibuster, there's no reason to have a Senate. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1325949677364269059/img/lHLENgaRdXcaG8tR.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1325949677364269059/vid/480x270/6crZxE-1zMgDreTr.mp4?tag=13

We should be focused on making it better, for example by creating a public option, not taking it away. The Supreme Court needs to rule on the side of the people. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/10/us/supreme-court-obamacare-aca.html
What was clear to me then and now is this: the Affordable Care Act isn't perfect, but it helps millions of Americans who couldn't get health care before take care of themselves now.
Many more people who previously had nowhere else to find coverage were able to go to the doctor to prevent things before they got bad and more expensive to deal with.
People with pre-existing conditions told me about how they struggled for their whole lives and finally were able to find affordable coverage and take care of themselves and their families.
I heard from young people who could focus on paying their student loans because they could stay on their parents plans longer.
In February of 2017, I held an event that stuck with me. At the @LynnCHC1, I heard from my constituents about how the #ACA has changed their lives.

To the state Dem party leaders, the DNC & Biden campaign staffs, the Dem elected leaders and candidates, & everyone who volunteered, joined our virtual meetings, and got involved, thank you! We not only won, but we started building the groundwork for more victories ahead.

I'm grateful to the Biden campaign and the DNC for working closely with me on strategy, organizing, and messaging to reach AAPI voters this election cycle, and we've already seen our efforts pay off with the high number of AAPI voters turning out this election.

With both the @DNC and @ASPIRE_PAC, we made unprecedented investments in AAPI outreach, including DNC hiring of AAPI organizers across the country, in language ad buys in ethnic media outlets, and helping to fund state parties and candidates.
I lead AAPI organizing efforts, voter education, and voter registration drives in my Queens community and across the country to make sure our AAPI communities had a voice in the election.

1 goal with both the in-person & virtual trips was to reach new voters & bring diverse voices to the table. Over these past few years, I've worked to ensure that our party built relationships with AAPIs, women & moms, rural communities, students, people with disabilities, & more.

I also hosted & participated in virtual events on behalf of @JoeBiden's campaign. I was proud to help lead their virtual AAPI bus tour – which @ASPIRE_PAC helped to coordinate – that made stops in key battleground states, and to participate in the campaign's Rural Bus Tour.

And the pandemic didn't stop my outreach efforts. In past months, I continued to meet virtually with state parties and voters across the country, in places as close as Massachusetts and North Carolina, and as far as Guam for rallies, fundraisers, and phone banks.

I've traveled across the country since 2017 in my @DNC and @ASPIRE_PAC capacities, with visits to nearly two dozen states, including Georgia, Nevada, Pennsylvania, Texas, and many other critical locations.

Republicans’ single-minded assault on Americans’ health care is in front of the Supreme Court today. If the Republicans win and dismantle the Affordable Care Act, it will do immeasurable harm to millions of Americans. #SaveTheACA

We just held an election, and our country made a clear choice: each vote for @JoeBiden was a statement that health care should be a right—not a privilege. 

And we won that election decisively, with more votes than have ever been cast in American history.
